mention.text: A naval commander who had observed the USS Vincennes in the Persian Gulf said the ship had `` no good reason '' for shooting down an Iranian civilian airliner , killing all 290 aboard The unusually candid article by Cmdr. David R. Carlson in the U.S. Naval Institute Proceedings magazine this month
the USS Vincennes in the Persian Gulf
`` no good reason '' for shooting down an Iranian civilian airliner
the U.S. Naval Institute Proceedings magazine
Carlson , commander of the USS Sides , a frigate that was on the scene when the USS Vincennes shot down the Airbus on July 3 , 1988
commander of the USS Sides , a frigate that was on the scene when the USS Vincennes shot down the Airbus on July 3 , 1988
an Iranian F-14 fighter plane Carlson , in Commander Carlson 's article , puts some of the blame on Commander Carlson 's `` Commander Carlson 's wondered aloud in disbelief
actions taken by the ship and disputed any notion of self-defense `` No profit has come from the pathetic postincident attempts to place the blame on the victims
her long suit Her actions appeared to be consistently aggressive , and had become a topic of wardroom conversation
skipper of the Vincennes at the time
Commander Carlson 's personal opinions of the Airbus incident
Commander Carlson 's comments in the magazine article
